{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=Orbi Satellite |revision=RBS20 (Gen2?) |fcc_date=09/15/2017 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |availability=new |type=range extender, wireless system |fcc_id=PY317400402 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm |cpu1_model=IPQ4019;IPQ4019, 0VV, NE7176GY, E071700; |cpu1_cspeed=716 MHz |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1=256 |fla1_brand=Winbond |fla1_model=W29N02GVSIAF |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W632GU6MB-12 |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip1_model=IPQ4019 |wi1_chip2_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip2_model=IPQ4019 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=QCA9886 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=2 |addl_chips=5 GHz WLAN Front-End Module;Skyworks;SKY85729-11;SKY, 729, 2F00R;2;, |flags=Wave2, MU-MIMO, 256QAM, DFS, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac }} {{TagLine|Netgear Orbi Satellite RBS20}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.netgear.com/orbi/rbk44.aspx}} (RBK44){{SupportPage|vendor=Netgear|model=RBS20}}{{â€¢}}[https://www.netgear.com/images/datasheet/orbi/RBS20.pdf Datasheet]
Included in kits: *[https://www.netgear.com/orbi/rbk22.aspx Orbi WiFi System (RBK22)] AC2200: :One (1x) [[Netgear Orbi Router (RBR20)]] :One (1x) [[Netgear Orbi Satellite (RBS20)]] *[https://www.netgear.com/orbi/rbk44.aspx Orbi WiFi System (RBK44)] AC2200: :One (1x) [[Netgear Orbi Router (RBR40)]] :Three (3x) [[Netgear Orbi Satellite (RBS20)]]
"2976564102" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. This is the same as on the Gen1 board.<!--{{FCC ST|08/14/2018|indexme.}} -->
Although the datasheet claims that the device contains a quad-core 710 MHz, the IPQ4019 pictured in FCC photos is believed to operate at 716 MHz.
Two different boards with the same layout are pictured in the FCC internal photos. One has Winbond flash and RAM but the spot for the Bluetooth chip, the second Winbond flash, and the digital temperature sensor are unpopulated while the other board has a larger Nanya RAM chip and includes the extra flash and temperature sensor. The board with the extra chips is probably just the [[Netgear Orbi Satellite (RBS20)|Gen1 device]] since FCC documents for this Gen2 model say that Bluetooth functionality will be removed.
